channel.title: Video software? [Editing/Publishing/Capturing]
channel.description:
I want to start making videos on youtube, they'll all contain some form of music that is added in later. Not actually during the recording process. That means I need a quality editor. One that won't cause lag or some issue with the song being added. I'd also like the capture software to be able to get hd videos.. (It's all going to be screen recorded.) Publishing isn't an issue, as long as it can publish in a youtube-safe format.
Ideas? [b]Don't say Windows Live Movie Maker and/or HyperCam, as we all know they suck, but [i]get the job done[/i][/b]

item.title: Video software? [Editing/Publishing/Capturing]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:14, topic:489789”]Editing: This depends on what you want to do to the video; I use either Sony Vegas Pro 11, or Adobe After Effects CS6.

Publishing: I always render my clips with Sony Vegas Pro 11.

Capturing: I started off using FRAPS, which records with amazing quality, but it is very resource dependent when it comes to your computer specs. I recently started using Dxtory, which has great quality too, while also being more friendly on the performance when compared to FRAPS.[/quote]
Someone else said DXtory, is it free or?

Read full topic

item.title: Video software? [Editing/Publishing/Capturing]
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Editing: This depends on what you want to do to the video; I use either Sony Vegas Pro 11, or Adobe After Effects CS6.

Publishing: I always render my clips with Sony Vegas Pro 11.

Capturing: I started off using FRAPS, which records with amazing quality, but it is very resource dependent when it comes to your computer specs. I recently started using Dxtory, which has great quality too, while also being more friendly on the performance when compared to FRAPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Video software? [Editing/Publishing/Capturing]
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:489789”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=608024.msg4230233#msg4230233 date=1361220899]
PirateBay(just use a proxy if your ISP blocks it) download Fraps (best screen recorder you’ll find)

Sony Vegas Pro 12, and Adobe After Effects

Google some tutorials and watch some videos. You’ll be a pro in no time!
[/quote]
I uh, got the CS6 mastersuite already

But I’ll be sure to look into those options.[/quote]

In this case I’d just use premire pro. Maybe some after effects in there. You already have them, so why not :)?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I can hook you up with that Vegas Pro 12 stuff… hit me up with a pm.
Camtasia is good for screen recording. Look for it on thepiratebay.

item.title: Video software? [Editing/Publishing/Capturing]
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Editing: AfterFX
Render/Publish: Sony Vegas
Record: Dxtory

I cannot express how much you should not use Camtasia

item.title: Video software? [Editing/Publishing/Capturing]
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

Lin:

Camstudio is free and open-source if you want a fast screen recorder. Camtasia is extremely slow and I’ve always been better off with Camstudio or Hypercam.

What kind of specs do you have? I have no issues with camtasia for recording at all.

I use sony vegas 12 and after effects CS5.5 for editing personally (a bit expensive, but theres… other ways of getting them that some people will do…), but if all your doing is putting music on top and basic cuts, you don’t need anything extreme. You could probably go with pinnicale studio or premiere elements or something. Look at some reviews online, download some trials- you’ll find something you like that works with your computer (some of the higher end stuff you’d want a good quality workstation for).

Read full topic
